byline.contributor: Taimoor Shah reported from Kandahar, and Mujib Mashal from Kabul, Afghanistan.
byline.original: By TAIMOOR SHAH and MUJIB MASHAL

abstract: Civilian cargo plane carrying supplies for NATO troops in Afghanistan crashes, killing seven crew members; surge of violence in country's south has drawn organization, which is helping coordinate response, back into conflict.

headline.print_headline: Plane Crash in Afghanistan Kills 7 in Crew
headline.main: Supply Plane for NATO Crashes in Afghanistan, Killing 7

snippet: Separately, in the southern province of Zabul, an attack by two Taliban infiltrators left at least eight policemen dead, officials said.
lead_paragraph: Separately, in the southern province of Zabul, an attack by two Taliban infiltrators left at least eight policemen dead, officials said.
